item.title: Asbestos: It Isn't Snow
item.description: Today in Tedium: Throughout our history as a country, we’ve quickly turned on popular products we once liked because of unintended effects from that product, usually health-related. (You know, like Chipotle.) But perhaps the product we’ve most famously done this with is asbestos, the naturally occurring fibery crystals that gained infamy after it was realized that those fibers were dangerous carcinogens. They represent an issue that still gets frequently litigated today.
